channel.title: Seminars 2S/2024 on FEEC/UNICAMP IA382 - Seminar in Computer Engineering
channel.description: Recent content in Seminars 2S/2024 on FEEC/UNICAMP IA382 - Seminar in Computer Engineering

item.title: More is different: How the Science of Complex Systems can inspire Future Autonomous Networks
item.description: Abstract # It is expected that future mobile networks will be ultra-large-scale, highly dynamic, and complex systems, encompassing a massive number of heterogeneous devices.

item.title: Let the Plants do the Talking: Climate-Smart Agriculture by the Messages Received from Plants and Soil
item.description: Abstract # As reported in the report recently issued by the United Nations (Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change â€“ IPCC Report 2021), the benefits that technology provides to a green and sustainable economy are highly appreciated and under intense research and development globally.

item.title: Cloud Storage Systems: Latency Characterization and Extensions
item.description: Abstract # Consumers are engaged in more social networking and E-commerce activities these days and are increasingly storing their documents and media in the online storage.

item.title: Scientific Machine Learning and Quantum Utility: A Near Future Perspective
Packet Trimming at the Edge for Low Latency in 6G Environments
item.description: Abstract # The talk presents the use of packet trimming, a technique which adjusts the size of a packet during its transmission over the network, and has the ability to provide low latency and low loss at the client.

item.title: An Overview of Evolutionary Multi-Objective Optimization
item.description: Abstract # Multi-objective optimization refers to solving problems having two or more (often conflicting) objectives at the same time.

item.title: From Intelligent Surfaces to Noise-Driven Communication: Innovative Technologies for 6G and Beyond
item.description: Abstract # Our community has witnessed the rise of many exciting communication technologies in recent years.

item.title: Generalist vs Specialist Language Models
item.description: Abstract # We are currently experiencing a paradigm shift in the field of artificial intelligence, where with every new version of a large language model, tasks that once seemed far from being solved are now being addressed.

item.title: AGI Chips - The Next Frontier
item.description: Abstract # General intelligence is a branch of AI research that aims to create machines capable of understanding and learning any intellectual task that a human can.

item.title: The Dawn of an Immersive Internet: XR, Generative AI and the Road to 6G
item.description: Abstract # This IEEE ComSoc Virtual Distinguished Lecture offers a timely and comprehensive exploration into the emergence of the next-generation internet.
